text: {{Infobox settlement | official_name = Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur | native_name = | native_name_lang = fr | settlement_type = Region of France | image_skyline = Menton-Côte d'Azur.jpg | image_caption = View of Menton | image_flag = Flag of Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur.svg | flag_size = 120px | image_shield = Arms of the French Region of Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur.svg | shield_size = | image_blank_emblem = | blank_emblem_size = 75px | image_map = Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur region locator map2.svg | map_caption = | motto = | coordinates = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = | seat_type = Prefecture | seat = Marseille | parts_type = Departments | parts_style = list | parts = 6 | p1 = Alpes-de-Haute-Provence | p2 = Alpes-Maritimes | p3 = Bouches-du-Rhône | p4 = Hautes-Alpes | p5 = Var | p6 = Vaucluse | p7 = | p8 = | p9 = | p10 = | p11 = | p12 = | p13 = | p14 = | leader_party = DVD | leader_title = President of the Regional Council | leader_name = Renaud Muselier | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 31400 | area_land_km2 = | area_water_km2 = | area_rank = 10th | population_total = | population_as_of = | population_footnotes = | population_density_km2 = auto | population_demonym = Provençals | timezone1 = CET | utc_offset1 = +01:00 | timezone1_DST = CEST | utc_offset1_DST = +02:00 | blank_name_sec1 = GDP (2012) | blank_info_sec1 = Ranked 3rd | blank1_name_sec1 = Total | blank1_info_sec1 = €142.4 billion (US$183.1 bn) | blank2_name_sec1 = Per capita | blank2_info_sec1 = €28,861 (US$37,121) | blank_name_sec2 = NUTS Region | blank_info_sec2 = FR8 | website = maregionsud.fr | iso_code = FR-PAC | footnotes = }} Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur or PACA (, Italian: Provenza-Alpi-Costa Azzurra) is one of the 18 administrative regions of France. Its capital is Marseille. ==Geography== The Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur region is the tenth largest region of France with an area of . It is in southeastern France and borders to the east with Monaco and Italy (with the Italian regions of Liguria and Piedmont). To the north is the Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes region and to the west is the Occitanie region. To the south, the Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur has about of coast along the Mediterranean Sea. The distances from Marseille, the capital of the region, to other cities are: * Paris, the national capital, ; * Toulouse, ; * Bordeaux, ; * Lyon, ; * Montpellier, ; * Nice, . ===Rivers=== The only main drainage basin in the region is the Mediterranean basin; some of the rivers in region are: * Rhône - * Durance - * Verdon - * Var - * Tinée - * Estéron - * Loup - * Vésubie - * Siagne - ===Mountains=== The Barre des Écrins, at , is the highest mountain of the Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur region. It is in the Écrins National Park (), one of the ten French national parks. The highest point of the different departments in the Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur region are: Department Mountain Elevation Alpes-de-Haute-Provence Aiguille de Chambeyron Hautes-Alpes Barre des Écrins Alpes-Maritimes Cime du Gélas Bouches-du-Rhône Bertagne Var Mont de Lachens Vaucluse Mont Ventoux ==Departments== The Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur region is formed by 6 departments: ISO 3166-2 Shield Department Prefecture Arr.
